unit_learning_outcomes.description: Critically analyse and explain the integrated nature of STEM teaching, learning and curriculum.
Apply the research foundations of the STEM thinking of students.
Engage in and contribute to a learning community.
Articulate pedagogical principles for developing students' STEM capabilities with reference to educational research and practice.
Critically reflect upon the efficacy of learning resources and pedagogical approaches to develop STEM capabilities.

assessments.assessment_title: Review/critique of Mathematics project/unit with STEM integration
assessments.description:
Part 1: Identify, describe and critique a suitable STEM-based project or unit, or STEM learning program or initiative in the primary school.  

Part 2: Based on your critique describe ways to revise or improve the unit drawing on theory, research and professional development through educational organizations such as PETA. This critique will become part of your ePortfolioSTEM-based learning module  (2500 words)

Demonstrate, explain and justify the interrelationships between Science, Technology Engineering and Mathematics concepts and processes through the development of a graphic, linked with relevant curricula, syllabi, research and theoretical principles.  (2500 words)

data.description: This unit is designed to establish a knowledge base for teacher education students to teach STEM using an integrated approach in the primary classroom.  Teacher education students will develop understanding of contemporary theory, concepts and skills associated with the study of STEM integration, its practices and associated pedagogies. The unit will focus on critically evaluating a range of STEM pedagogical approaches and learning resources to develop students' STEM capabilities. The unit uses authentic STEM topics to deconstruct and emphasise key principles surrounding STEM based learning, including the pedagogies that support STEM learning, how research can inform STEM teaching, critical evaluation of STEM modules and resources, and the importance of clear curriculum links.
